Ivory Coast king seeks to exorcise coronavirus with naked women tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735881 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/world/735881/ivory-coast-king-seeks-to-exorcise-coronavirus-with-naked-women/story/ An aide to an influential king in Ivory Coast has said the monarch could order a procession of naked women to ward off coronavirus by seeking the protection of spirits. Tue, 28 Apr 2020 12:47:29 +0800
Duterte offers P20-M reward to any Filipino who can develop respirators tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735880 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735880/duterte-offers-p20-m-reward-to-any-filipino-who-can-develop-respirators/story/ Presidential spokesperson Harry Roque said President Rodrigo Duterte pointed out that the respirators should "outlast the lives" of the patients. Previously, the President promised to give P50 million as a reward to any Filipino who can create a vaccine against COVID-19. Tue, 28 Apr 2020 12:44:33 +0800
Robredo calls on police, military to be humane on imposing quarantine measures tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735879 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735879/robredo-calls-on-police-military-to-be-humane-on-imposing-quarantine-measures/story/ Vice President Leni Robredo on Tuesday called on the police and the military to be humane in implementing enhanced community quarantine guidelines amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Tue, 28 Apr 2020 12:39:06 +0800
Ilang taga-Antipolo, ibinalik ang P6,500 na ayuda mula DSWD tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735877 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/ulatfilipino/735877/ilang-taga-antipolo-ibinalik-ang-p6-500-na-ayuda-mula-dswd/story/ Ibinalik ng ilang residente ng Antipolo City ang kanilang social amelioration card (SAC) forms o ang natanggap na nilang P6,500 mula sa Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD). Tue, 28 Apr 2020 12:34:30 +0800
Clark COVID-19 testing facility to be completed by Wednesday tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735876 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/regions/735876/clark-covid-19-testing-facility-to-be-completed-by-wednesday/story/ A new testing facility for the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is expected to be completed in Clark this week, the Bases Conversion and Development Authority (BCDA) said Tuesday. Tue, 28 Apr 2020 12:26:59 +0800
Lorenzana on AFP chief s request to Chinese envoy: Hindi naman siguro improper, wala lang sa lugar tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735875 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735875/lorenzana-nothing-wrong-with-afp-chief-requesting-aid-from-chinese-envoy-to-procure-covid-19-meds/story/ "Hindi naman siguro improper 'yung ginawa niya. Wala lang sa lugar. Dahil dapat 'yung mga ganoong sulat ay idadaan muna sa Department of Foreign Affairs," Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana said at a Laging Handa press briefing. Tue, 28 Apr 2020 12:18:13 +0800
Marikina COVID-19 lab yet to finish proficiency testing to get certification --DOH exec tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735873 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735873/marikina-covid-19-lab-yet-to-finish-proficiency-testing-to-get-certification-doh-exec/story/ Marikina City's own testing laboratory for coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) has yet to finish the proficiency testing stage before it can secure an accreditation, a Department of Health (DOH) official said Tuesday. Tue, 28 Apr 2020 12:08:52 +0800
Foreigners not exempted from Philippine laws, BI says after Dasma incident tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735872 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735872/foreigners-not-exempted-from-philippine-laws-bi-says-after-dasma-incident/story/ Foreigners are not exempted from Philippine laws, the Bureau of Immigration (BI) said as it investigates an incident involving a Spanish man confronting a police officer over an alleged quarantine violation in Makati City. Tue, 28 Apr 2020 12:00:01 +0800
AFP chief's letter asking for aid to procure medicine from China for COVID-19 already withdrawn -Arevalo tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735870 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735870/afp-chief-s-letter-asking-for-aid-to-procure-medicine-from-china-for-covid-19-already-withdrawn-arevalo/story/ The letter of Armed Forces chief General Felimon Santos asking assistance from a Chinese official to procure medicine for coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) was authentic but it has already been withdrawn, spokesman Brigadier General Edgard Arevalo said Tuesday. Tue, 28 Apr 2020 11:44:39 +0800
House leadership files 'new normal' bill amid COVID-19 pandemic tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735868 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735868/house-leadership-files-new-normal-bill-amid-covid-19-pandemic/story/ The House leadership led by Speaker Alan Peter Cayetano has filed the measure institutionalizing the "new norms" to be practiced by Filipinos for the next three years at most in the wake of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) health crisis. Tue, 28 Apr 2020 11:42:05 +0800
DOH: Wearing of face masks will always be part of new normal to defeat COVID-19 tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735867 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735867/doh-wearing-of-face-masks-will-always-be-part-of-new-normal-to-defeat-covid-19/story/ "Itong pagsusuot ng mask ay hindi na mawawala sa ating mga patakaran. We are going into this new normal already kung saan whatever state of quarantine your area is in, ang mask ay palagi nang andiyan," Health Undersecretary Maria Rosario Vergeire said in a virtual conference. "It's part of the new normal. Masks will always be part of our protocol," she added. Tue, 28 Apr 2020 11:27:33 +0800
Caloocan to distribute P500 cash aid to public school students tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735865 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/metro/735865/caloocan-to-distribute-p500-cash-aid-to-public-school-students/story/ The 268,036 public school students in Caloocan City, from kinder to senior high school, is set to receive P500 each to aid their families amid the extended enhanced community quarantine, Caloocan City Mayor Oscar Malapitan said Tuesday. Tue, 28 Apr 2020 11:19:30 +0800
RITM, subnational labs operating 16 hours daily --DOH tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735864 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735864/ritm-subnational-labs-operating-16-hours-daily-doh/story/ Round-the-clock work is in place at testing laboratories across the Philippines in an effort to efficiently detect coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), according to Health Undersecretary Maria Rosario Vergeire on Tuesday. Tue, 28 Apr 2020 11:01:19 +0800
Fire hits Army building; no casualty reported tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735862 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/metro/735862/fire-hits-army-building-no-casualty-reported/story/ "This is an unfortunate event for the Philippine Army, however, we are very thankful that no one got hurt from the incident. We deeply appreciate how other units and cities immediately responded in helping us to stop the fire before it caused further destruction to other Army properties," Army spokesperson Colonel Ramon Zagala said. Tue, 28 Apr 2020 10:57:51 +0800
Authorities urged to check if acts of foreigner in Makati village could get him deported tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735859 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/metro/735859/authorities-urged-to-check-if-acts-of-foreigner-in-makati-village-could-get-him-deported/story/ A party-list lawmaker called on authorities to look into whether the acts of the Spanish citizen living in a posh subdivision in Makati City who was involved in an altercation incident with a police officer warrant his deportation. Tue, 28 Apr 2020 10:36:30 +0800
